Description: Part of a necklace: of barrel, long convex bicone and lenticular beads. The five cornelian barrel and long convex bicone beads are rather light in colour, a characteristic feature of the cornelian used during the Old Kingdom. Two of the lenticular beads are of mottled black and white porphyry, the long central lenticular bead is of steatite and the short truncated convex bicone bead of green glazed composition. The two remaining long convex bi-cones are of steatite. At either end of the central steatite bead are the remains of two copper disc beads.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Mostagedda, Grave 1420 Found at the neck of a female
Curator's comments: For the remainder of the necklace, see 1929,1015.536. Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 97; Tomb register. pl.XLV; Bead register, pl.XLIX; Bead corpus. pl.LVIII, 78B3, 5, C7, M14; 79B4, F8; 'L'art egyptien au temps des pyramides' [exhibition catalogue] (Paris, 1999), p. 328 [158].
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (243)
Metropolitan Museum of Art 1999 / Egyptian Art in the Age of the Pyramids (165)
